did.head: Collection Summary

physdesc.label: Extent
physdesc.extent: 4 drawers, 5 boxes, 10 slide carousels, 74 albums and scrapbooks

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Wilton History Room, Wilton Historical Society

did.abstract: The Wilton Historical Society Photograph Collection contains photographs, slides, postcards, paintings, line drawings, and other imagery pertaining to Wilton history. Many of these items are loose; some are framed or matted;a large number are stored as they were originally arranged: in family photograph albums, personal scrapbooks, and slide carousels. The bulk of the collection is from the late nineteenth century through the mid-twentieth century.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Wilton History Room, Wilton Historical Society.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Title or description], [folder, box, and/or item number(s)], Wilton Historical Society Photograph Collection, Wilton History Room, Wilton Historical Society, Wilton Library, Wilton, Connecticut.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Wilton Historical Society Photograph Collection was compiled by the Wilton Historical Society.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Wilton Historical Society, founded in 1938, collected extensive photographic materials pertaining to Wilton families, scenery, buildings, and artistic productions. Additions have been made by Carol Russell, Wilton Historical Society Archivist and Wilton Town Historian. The majority of the material included was created by professional photographers, local residents, and Wilton artists.

The Wilton History Room is a unique collaboration between the Wilton Historical Society (WHS) and the Wilton Library Association (WLA). Compiled beginning in 1938, the archival collections of the Wilton Historical Society had been stored in the 18th century Fitch House. In 1980, the officers and trustees of the WHS, in conversation with the director and board members of the WLA, determined that a climate controlled space, improved organization, and better public accessibility were necessary; and so in January 1984 they established a home for the collection in the Wilton Library. Organization of the collections was supported by the Cudlipp Memorial Fund and undertaken by Carol Russell. The Wilton Historical Society has retained its ownership, while the Wilton Library maintains the collections, and provides access and assistance to patrons.

The Wilton History Room is one of the most complete, organized, and well-staffed historical research facilities, for a town of our size, in Fairfield County. It is financed by the WLA, The Russell Fund, and The History Room Fund.

The Wilton History Room is one of the most complete, organized, and well-staffed historical research facilities, for a town of our size, in Fairfield County. It is supported by the WHS, the WLA, The Russell Fund, The History Room Fund, local non-profit organizations, individual donors, and community volunteers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the collection features portraiture of Wilton families and individuals, images of Wilton houses and buildings, economic activities such as farming and animal husbandry, schools and railroads, local scenery and landmarks, and public and private events and celebrations. Photographic types represented in the collection range from early daguerreotypes, ambrotypes, and tintypes, through cabinet cards, late nineteenth and early twentieth century snapshots, and mid- to late twentieth century Polaroids and 35mm slides. In addition to photography, this collection includes original artwork such as paintings and line drawings, scrapbooks containing greeting cards, trade cards, and newspaper clippings, as well as a significant number of late nineteenth and early twentieth century postcards, many depicting scenes from Wilton, Georgetown, and Cannondale.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by family name, location, or topic. Items are housed in folders, boxes, and albums.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Collections
relatedmaterial.p: Researchers should also consult the Wilton History Room's book collection, and the list of art displayed in the Wilton Library.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Select additional photographs, postcards, drawings, and paintings are in the Wilton Historical Society Museum.

note.p: This is collection of loose snapshots. It is filed out of order in a box and shelved with the bulk of the Ambler collection.

This is a scrapbook of newspaper clippings. It is stored in a box and shelved with the bulk of the Ambler collection. The original Wilton Historical Society accession number for this item is 98.12.255.

This is a scrapbook of newspaper clippings. It is stored in a box and shelved with the bulk of the Ambler collection. The original Wilton Historical Society accession number for this item is 98.12.258.

This is scrapbook of newspaper clippings, including several advertisements for travel. It likely belonged to Elizabeth Raymond. It is stored in a box and shelved with the bulk of the Ambler collection.

This is a scrapbook of newspaper clippings, including ones about local churches and motherhood. It likely belonged to Hannah Raymond Ambler. It is stored in a box and shelved with the bulk of the Ambler collection.

This Elizabeth "Betty" Raymond Ambler's childhood scrapbook. It contains trade cards, newspaper clippings, and pictures of animals by Harry Whittier Frees. It is stored in a box and shelved with the bulk of the Ambler collection.

This is a scrapbook of newspaper clippings relating to family news, President and Mrs. McKinley, Queen Victoria, the DAR, and various other topics. It likely belonged to Hannah Raymond Ambler. It is stored in a box and shelved with the bulk of the Ambler collection.

This is a scrapbook of newspaper clippings relating to family news, local and national politics, and letterhead from hotels patronized in Washington, D.C.; Niagara Falls, New York; and Bethlehem, New Hampshire. It likely belonged to Hannah Raymond Ambler. It is stored in a box and shelved with the bulk of the Ambler collection.

This is a scrapbook of newspaper clippings relating to family news, local and national politics, local churches, and advertisements for Elmore cars. It likely belonged to Hannah Raymond Ambler. It is stored in a box and shelved with the bulk of the Ambler collection.
This is a collection of postcards. It is filed out of order in a box near the Ambler collection.
This is a photograph album of a trip to England. It is filed out of order in a box.
